quotes.quote: The pen is the lever that moves the world.
Your pen is your sword. Wield it wisely.
Do not pick up the pen unless you understand how heavy it is, and how long you may carry it for.
Pens carry further than rifled cannon.

The pen is an instrument of discovery rather than just a recording implement. If you write a letter of resignation or something with an agenda, you're simply using a pen to record what you have thought out.
The pen is the tongue of the mind.
There is more done with pens than with swords.
The pens which write against disarmament are made with the same steel from which guns are made.
A pen transmits the voice of the soul.
The power of the pen is landmark of life.
The pen is the tongue of the soul; as are the thoughts engendered there, so will be the things written.
The pen is mightier than the sword if the sword is very short, and the pen is very sharp.
No pen can give an adequate description of the all-pervading corruption produced by slavery.
The pen is mightier than the sword, if you know where to poke it.
Keeping the pen out of your hand as much as possible is the best way to write a song, in my estimation. But the pen must come in to tighten it up.
The pen is the language of the soul; as the concepts that in it are generated, such will be its writings.
The magic of the pen lies in the concentration of your thoughts upon one object.
Putting pen to paper lights more fire than matches ever will.
A pen is certainly an excellent instrument to fix a man's attention and to inflame his ambition.
A pen connects you to the paper. It definitely matters.
For all sad words of tongue and pen, The saddest are these It might have been.
Every writing career starts as a personal quest for sainthood, for self-betterment. Sooner or later, and as a rule quite soon, a man discovers that his pen accomplishes a lot more than his soul.
I am a creature of my pen. My pen is the best of me.
It is through the tongue, the pen, and the press that truth is principally propagated.
You can make anything by writing.
How can one not dream while writing? It is the pen which dreams. The blank page gives the right to dream.
There is always a sheet of paper. There is always a pen. There is always a way out.
Sadness takes up the pen more readily than joy.
The pen is the tongue of the hand; a silent utterer of words for the eye.
